class_description:
A URL Connection to a Java ARchive (JAR) file or an entry in a JAR
 file. The syntax of a JAR URL is: for example: jar:http://www.foo.com/bar/baz.jar!/COM/foo/Quux.class Jar URLs should be used to refer to a JAR file or entries in
 a JAR file. The example above is a JAR URL which refers to a JAR
 entry. If the entry name is omitted, the URL refers to the whole
 JAR file:

 jar:http://www.foo.com/bar/baz.jar!/ Users should cast the generic URLConnection to a
 JarURLConnection when they know that the URL they created is a JAR
 URL, and they need JAR-specific functionality. For example: JarURLConnection instances can only be used to read from JAR files.
 It is not possible to get a OutputStream to modify or write
 to the underlying JAR file using this class. Examples: !/ is referred to as the separator. When constructing a JAR url via new URL(context, spec),
 the following rules apply:
